description: Depletes fish populations and damages ecosystems.
Lost fishing gear entangles turtles, mammals, and seabirds.
Non-target species caught and killed in fisheries.
Heat stress causes corals to expel symbionts and die.
COâ‚‚ lowers pH, weakening shells and coral skeletons.
Toxic hydrocarbons coat habitats and wildlife.
Nutrient runoff triggers algal blooms and dead zones.
Ship noise disrupts whale and dolphin communication.
Ingested particles accumulate through food webs.
Habitat loss from dredging, tourism, and urbanization.
Non-native species outcompete local fauna and flora.
Instant habitat damage, especially to coral reefs.
Bioaccumulates in top predators, risks to humans.
Vessel collisions injure or kill large marine animals.
Floods coastal nurseries like mangroves and marshes.
